content.question: The figure shows the graphs of the polar curves <math alttext="r equals, 4 times, open parenthesis, the sine of 2 theta, close parenthesis, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>θ</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="r equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="0 less than or equal to theta, less than or equal to the fraction pi over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>≤</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the area of the shaded region?

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.9: (BC ONLY) Finding the Area of the Region Bounded by Two Polar Curves

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
